column1: Vasoactive intestinal peptide (VIP) is a test that measures the amount of VIP in the blood.
This test is used to measure VIP level in the blood.
VIP is a substance found in cells throughout the body.

VIP has many functions, including relaxing certain muscles, triggering release of hormones from the pancreas, gut, and hypothalamus, and increasing the amount of water and electrolytes secreted from the pancreas and gut.
This blood test checks the amount of VIP in the blood to see if a person has a VIPoma.
A higher-than-normal level, along with symptoms of watery diarrhea and flushing, may be a sign of a VIPoma.
